alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 17 at 3:13AM CST until February 17 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Rapid Growth and Spread of Wildfires Possible Today... .A weak cold front will move through Deep South Texas and the Rio Grande Valley this morning. Drier air will filter into the region late this morning through this afternoon. Relative humidity values will crash into the teens across most interior land areas. Dry fuels and a lack of significant rain will exacerbate the situation. In addition...northwest 20 foot winds of 15 to 20 mph including higher gusts will develop in the wake of the front. The combination of winds, dry air, and dry fuels will increase rapid and erratic wildfire growth and spread potential. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS FOR PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Starr, and Hidalgo Counties. * TIMING...9 AM to 8 PM Today. * WIND...Northwest to north 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
